Key Match Events: Nikola Jokic recorded a triple-double with 30 points, 11 rebounds, and 14 assists on 11-of-13 shooting and 7-of-7 from the free-throw line.
Jamal Murray had his best game of the season, finishing with 28 points on 9-of-17 shooting, including four 3-pointers, plus four rebounds and six assists.
Michael Porter Jr. and Christian Braun each scored 21 points.
Peyton Watson, starting in place of the injured Aaron Gordon, scored 16 points on 7-of-11 shooting.
Tyler Herro led the Heat with 24 points, 11 assists, and seven rebounds on 10-of-21 shooting and 4-of-10 from 3-point range.
Jimmy Butler sprained his right ankle in the first quarter and did not return, finishing with two points, one rebound, and two assists in seven minutes.
Post-Match Reflections: The Nuggets have now beaten the Heat in nine straight regular-season meetings, dating back to the COVID-shortened 2020-21 season.
Miami has just one victory inside Ball Arena since the 2016-17 season (Game 2, 2024 NBA Finals).
Miami has now lost three straight games after losses to Sacramento and Phoenix, dropping to 3-5 on the season and 0-3 against the Western Conference.
